content.text:
<task>
Update `README.md` to correct the Godot version.
Change the reference from "4.4.1" to "4.5.1" to match the version specified in `scripts/godot_setup.sh`.
Verify the change and report completion.
</task>

content.thinking: The user wants me to update README.md to change the Godot version from "4.4.1" to "4.5.1". This is a straightforward task. Let me read the README.md to find where 4.4.1 is mentioned and update it.

content.text:
[Memory Bank: Active]

<read_file>
<args>
  <file>
    <path>README.md</path>
  </file>
</args>
</read_file>

[Response interrupted by a tool use result. Only one tool may be used at a time and should be placed at the end of the message.]
[read_file for 'README.md'. Reading multiple files at once is more efficient for the LLM. If other files are relevant to your current task, please read them simultaneously.] Result:

<files>
<file><path>README.md</path>
<content lines="1-221">
  1 | # Terminal Custom Setup
  2 | 
  3 | Automated terminal and development environment setup for Nobara 42 / Fedora.
  4 | 
  5 | ## Features
  6 | 
  7 | - **Shell Environment**: Zsh, Starship prompt, Atuin history, Fastfetch
  8 | - **Terminal**: Kitty GPU-accelerated terminal with Catppuccin theme
  9 | - **Fonts**: Nerd Fonts (CaskaydiaCove, FiraCode, JetBrains Mono)
 10 | - **Tmux**: Multiplexer with TPM plugins, session persistence
 11 | - **Power Tools**: zoxide, eza, bat, fzf, lazygit, yazi
 12 | - **Containers**: Podman & Podman Compose
 13 | - **VS Code**: Installation, extensions, and settings restoration
 14 | - **Qdrant**: Vector database with auto-start systemd service
 15 | - **Godot Engine**: Game engine with VS Code integration
 16 | - **Additional Apps**: Chrome, Dropbox, Discord, Obsidian, Anki
 17 | - **Cisco Packet Tracer**: Network simulation tool
 18 | - **Vietnamese Input**: ibus-bamboo for Vietnamese typing
 19 | 
 20 | ## Quick Start
 21 | 
 22 | ```bash
 23 | # Clone the repository
 24 | git clone <repo-url> terminal-custom
 25 | cd terminal-custom
 26 | 
 27 | # Full installation
 28 | ./setup.sh
 29 | 
 30 | # Or minimal (core only)
 31 | ./setup.sh --minimal
 32 | ```
 33 | 
 34 | ## Usage
 35 | 
 36 | ```bash
 37 | ./setup.sh [OPTIONS]
 38 | 
 39 | Options:
 40 |   --minimal           Core setup only (shell, dotfiles, fonts)
 41 |   --enhance           Install power tools (zoxide, eza, bat, fzf, lazygit, yazi)
 42 |   --skip-vscode       Skip VS Code installation
 43 |   --skip-qdrant       Skip Qdrant setup
 44 |   --skip-godot        Skip Godot installation
 45 |   --skip-apps         Skip additional apps (Chrome, Dropbox, Flatpaks)
 46 |   --skip-packettracer Skip Cisco Packet Tracer installation
 47 |   --vietnamese        Install Vietnamese input method (ibus-bamboo)
 48 |   --help              Show help message
 49 | 
 50 | Examples:
 51 |   ./setup.sh                              # Full installation
 52 |   ./setup.sh --minimal                    # Core setup only
 53 |   ./setup.sh --enhance                    # Add power tools to existing setup
 54 |   ./setup.sh --skip-godot --skip-apps     # Skip Godot and apps
 55 | ```
 56 | 
 57 | ## Project Structure
 58 | 
 59 | ```
 60 | .
 61 | ├── setup.sh                    # Master orchestrator script
 62 | ├── assets/                     # Configuration data and assets
 63 | │   ├── .zshrc, .bashrc, .gitconfig
 64 | │   ├── .config/                # App configs (starship, atuin, fastfetch, kitty)
 65 | │   ├── fonts/                  # Nerd Fonts collection
 66 | │   ├── godot/                  # Godot editor settings
 67 | │   ├── vscode/                 # VS Code settings and extensions
 68 | │   ├── images/                 # Custom assets (fastfetch logo)
 69 | │   └── CiscoPacketTracer*.deb  # Packet Tracer installer (optional)
 70 | └── scripts/
 71 |     ├── common.sh               # Shared utilities and logging
 72 |     ├── core_setup.sh           # System updates, packages, shell, fonts, dotfiles
 73 |     ├── enhance_terminal.sh     # Power tools and enhanced configs
 74 |     ├── vscode_setup.sh         # VS Code installation and configuration
 75 |     ├── qdrant_setup.sh         # Qdrant vector database with Podman
 76 |     ├── godot_setup.sh          # Godot Engine installation
 77 |     ├── apps_setup.sh           # Chrome, Dropbox, Flatpak apps
 78 |     ├── packettracer_setup.sh   # Cisco Packet Tracer installation
 79 |     └── input_setup.sh          # Vietnamese input method (ibus-bamboo)
 80 | ```
 81 | 
 82 | ## What Gets Installed
 83 | 
 84 | ### Core Setup (`core_setup.sh`)
 85 | - System update (dnf)
 86 | - Packages: zsh, git, curl, wget, util-linux-user, fastfetch, kitty, podman, podman-compose, tmux
 87 | - Starship prompt, Atuin shell history
 88 | - Zsh plugins: autosuggestions, syntax-highlighting, autocomplete
 89 | - Dotfiles: .zshrc, .bashrc, .gitconfig
 90 | - Config directories: starship, atuin, fastfetch, kitty, tmux
 91 | - Fonts installed to ~/.local/share/fonts
 92 | - Default shell changed to Zsh
 93 | 
 94 | ### Terminal Enhancement (`enhance_terminal.sh`)
 95 | - **Power Tools**:
 96 |   - `zoxide` - Smart cd replacement (learns your directories)
 97 |   - `eza` - Modern ls with icons, colors, and git status
 98 |   - `bat` - Cat with syntax highlighting
 99 |   - `fzf` - Fuzzy finder with Catppuccin theme
100 |   - `ripgrep` - Fast grep alternative
101 |   - `fd-find` - Fast find alternative
102 |   - `lazygit` - Terminal UI for git
103 |   - `yazi` - Terminal file manager with image preview
104 | - **Tmux Plugins** (via TPM):
105 |   - Catppuccin theme
106 |   - tmux-resurrect (save/restore sessions)
107 |   - tmux-continuum (auto-save sessions)
108 |   - tmux-yank (system clipboard)
109 | - **Enhanced Configs**:
110 |   - `.zshrc.enhanced` with aliases and tool integrations
111 |   - `kitty.conf.enhanced` with CaskaydiaCove Nerd Font & Catppuccin
112 |   - `tmux.conf.enhanced` with TPM and Catppuccin theme
113 |   - `starship-catppuccin.toml` optional Catppuccin starship theme
114 | 
115 | **New Aliases After Enhancement:**
116 | ```bash
117 | ls  → eza --icons              # List with icons
118 | ll  → eza -la --icons --git    # Detailed list with git status
119 | lt  → eza --tree               # Tree view
120 | cat → bat                       # Syntax highlighted cat
121 | lg  → lazygit                   # Git TUI
122 | y   → yazi                      # File manager (cd on exit)
123 | z   → zoxide                    # Smart directory jumping
124 | ```
125 | 
126 | ### VS Code Setup (`vscode_setup.sh`)
127 | - VS Code installation via Microsoft repo
128 | - Settings and keybindings restoration
129 | - Extensions installation from extensions.txt
130 | - Kilo Code global storage restoration
131 | 
132 | ### Qdrant Setup (`qdrant_setup.sh`)
133 | - Podman container setup
134 | - Systemd user service (auto-start on boot)
135 | - Available at http://localhost:6333
136 | 
137 | ### Godot Setup (`godot_setup.sh`)
138 | - Downloads Godot (default: 4.4.1, configurable via `GODOT_VERSION` env var)
139 | - Installs to ~/.local/bin/godot
140 | - Restores editor settings with VS Code integration
141 | - Creates desktop entry
142 | 
143 | ### Apps Setup (`apps_setup.sh`)
144 | - Google Chrome (DNF)
145 | - Dropbox (DNF)
146 | - Discord, Obsidian, Anki (Flatpak)
147 | 
148 | ### Packet Tracer Setup (`packettracer_setup.sh`)
149 | - Converts Ubuntu .deb package for Fedora
150 | - Installs Qt5 dependencies
151 | - Non-interactive installation
152 | 
153 | ### Vietnamese Input Setup (`input_setup.sh`)
154 | - Installs ibus and ibus-bamboo
155 | - Configures IBus environment variables
156 | - Supports Telex typing method (default)
157 | 
158 | ## Individual Script Usage
159 | 
160 | You can run individual scripts directly:
161 | 
162 | ```bash
163 | # Run only terminal enhancement
164 | bash scripts/enhance_terminal.sh
165 | 
166 | # Run only VS Code setup
167 | bash scripts/vscode_setup.sh
168 | 
169 | # Run only Qdrant setup
170 | bash scripts/qdrant_setup.sh
171 | 
172 | # Install Godot with specific version
173 | GODOT_VERSION=4.3 bash scripts/godot_setup.sh
174 | 
175 | # Uninstall Godot
176 | bash scripts/godot_setup.sh --uninstall
177 | 
178 | # Uninstall Packet Tracer
179 | bash scripts/packettracer_setup.sh --uninstall
180 | 
181 | # Install Vietnamese input
182 | bash scripts/input_setup.sh
183 | ```
184 | 
185 | ## Post-Enhancement Setup
186 | 
187 | After running `./setup.sh --enhance`, complete these steps:
188 | 
189 | 1. **Restart terminal** or run `source ~/.zshrc`
190 | 
191 | 2. **Install tmux plugins**: Open tmux and press `Ctrl+a` then `I` (capital i)
192 | 
193 | 3. **Optional - Use Catppuccin Starship theme**:
194 |    ```bash
195 |    cp ~/.config/starship/starship-catppuccin.toml ~/.config/starship.toml
196 |    ```
197 | 
198 | 4. **Zoxide**: Just start using `z` command - it learns your directories automatically
199 | 
200 | 5. **FZF keybindings**:
201 |    - `Ctrl+R` - Search command history
202 |    - `Ctrl+T` - Search files
203 |    - `Alt+C` - cd to directory
204 | 
205 | ## Requirements
206 | 
207 | - Nobara 42 or Fedora-based distribution
208 | - User with sudo access
209 | - Internet connection
210 | 
211 | ## Legacy Scripts
212 | 
213 | Previous installation scripts are preserved in `terminal_backup/` for reference:
214 | - `install.sh` - Original all-in-one script
215 | - `install_apps.sh` - Original apps installer
216 | - `install_godot.sh` - Original Godot installer
217 | - `install_packettracer.sh` - Original Packet Tracer installer
218 | 
219 | ## License
220 | 
221 | Personal configuration backup - use at your own discretion.
</content>
</file>
